alert.note: Alert for Hocking (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 1:16AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF FAIRFIELD AND HOCKING COUNTIES THROUGH 145 AM EDT... At 116 AM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Lancaster, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph, frequent cloud-to-ground lightning, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Lancaster, Logan, Nelsonville, Baltimore, Bremen, Pleasantville, Hocking Hills State Park, Hide-A-Way Hills, Starr, Royalton, Lithopolis, Amanda, Thurston, Laurelville, Carroll, Murray City, Sugar Grove, Rushville, West Rushville and Fairfield County Airport. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
